drawEqu

Class houghTransform

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • drawEqu.houghTransform
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class houghTransform
extends java.lang.Thread
    This is the class which forms the hough transform which is a method for detecting lines in an image along with canny's line detection
    Author:
    Hoda, Menna

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        public void initialise()
        Initializes the hough array. Called by the constructor can be used to reset the transform in case you need to add another image but it has to be of the same dimension

      • getPoints

        public void getPoints(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Parameters:
        image - : the image which is scanned to count the pixels which are assumed to be edges and adds them as points the image has to be in grey scale mode the image has to be of the same dimensions as the one passed to the constructor

        adds a single point to the hough array
        Parameters:

        y -

      • getLines

        public java.util.Vector<houghLine> getLines(int threshold)
        This method extracts the lines from the hough array and saves them in a vector of hough line objects
        Parameters:
        threshold - : to determine the minimum number of intersections between curves of hough array
        Returns:
        vector of hough line objects

      • getMaximumValue

        public int getMaximumValue()
        you can use it if you want
        Returns:
        the maximum value in the hough array to be used in drawing hough array image

      • formHoughArrImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage formHoughArrImage()
        Gets an image for the hough array in the form of a buffered image with black color for the curves of hough array and white color for the back ground just in case you want to. " not used "
